title: AI Didn't Replace Judgment. It Exposed It.
content:
AI isn't changing real estate by thinking for us.

It's changing it by making logic cheap to implement.

For the first time, non-technical teams can translate their decision-making into executable systems using natural language.

But here's what that exposed:

Most teams don't actually know how their decisions work.

They just know that experienced people make them.

The bottleneck is no longer "Can we build this?"

It's "Do we understand our own logic well enough to encode it?"

The teams winning right now are:

→ Extracting judgment from individuals
→ Structuring it into systems
→ Deciding where automation ends and humans step in

The advantage won't belong to teams that "use AI."

It'll belong to teams that understand their own operations well enough to know where AI fits.

What's the one decision in your workflow that you couldn't explain to a system?
author: Dylan Goren
